# Python & PyCharm Installation - Windows

## 1. Install Python 3

Follow this tutorial video to install the latest version of Python 3 on Windows:

> The video author provides detailed explanations to help you fully understand each step. If you're in a hurry, you can skip them.

[![install python](data:image/jpeg;base64,)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YKSpANU8jPE&ab_channel=PythonProgrammer)



## 2. Verify the installation

**Windows** ðŸªŸ

- On your Windows PC, type *CMD* in the search bar to open the ***Command Line Prompt*** 

- Type the following command and hit the <kbd>Enter</kbd> button: 

  ```cmd
  python --version
  ```


> âš ï¸ If python is not installed properly on your PC, this command will not be recognized. 
>
> âš ï¸ If you are sure to have correctly installed python, try this command instead `python3` 

## 3. Install PyCharm

Follow this tutorial to install the latest version of  **PyCharm Community Edition**:

 

[![install python](data:image/jpeg;base64,)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Za0s3_y5hlY&ab_channel=LogicLambda)



> âš ï¸ If you've installed PyCharm Professional Edition, you can request a free educational license with your student account, follow the steps on [this page](https://www.jetbrains.com/community/education/#students)
>
> If you don't want to go through the hassle, [uninstall PyCharm](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/pycharm/uninstall.html#windows), then go back to the video and make sure to install **Community Edition**.
